data.title: George Edward Parkes (1830-1901)
data.meta_description: Is this your ancestor? Explore genealogy for George Parkes born 1830 Birmingham St Martin, Warwickshire, England, United Kingdom died 1901 Warwick, Warwickshire, England including father + descendants + 3 photos + 1 genealogist comments + more in the free family tree community.
data.text:
Descendants

This page has been accessed 444 times.

Contents

1 Biography

2 Records

3 Census

4 Sources

Biography

Son of Samuel Parkes and Mary Wheeler -- Yes, sister is also daughter of Samuel Parkes and Mary

Married Sarah Ann Parkes in 1858 in Saint Swithin, Worcester, Worcestershire, England. She died on September 17, 1880, on board Royal Mail Ship Don at Southampton.

Married Elizabeth Parkes (widow of George Parkes, Esq. Tyseley, Worchestershire) on August 29, 1885, in Kings Norton, Worcestershire, England

I was looking over your newest entries for George Edward Parkes. I haven't done much updating myself because I'm trying to verify my findings. I thought I would pass on some family information in case that helps things.

I do believe George Edward Parkes was born in 1832 (not 1830,) but they weren't too particular about these dates back then so perhaps it's close enough? I'm trying to find accuracy on that.

G.E. Parkes was my great-great grandfather. He was born in Birmingham and was twice married. He was a Cunard Chief Officer and his main shipping line was from England to Jamaica. We have old family black and white photos of trips to Jamaica, Canada and England. George purchased a plantation in Jamaica and, while he had his main residence in England, he also lived parts of the year in Jamaica. While in Jamaica his wife (I think it was Sarah Ann, but I'm not confident of that,) was bitten by a spider and died. George married a second time, which may be Elizabeth, but I'm not sure. Our family oral history tells that George married someone from Jamaica, but I have no confirmation of that.

I'm having trouble confirming information about George. I can confirm that his son, George Edward Parkes, was born in 1866 as this is my great-grandfather.

I'm trying the Cunard connection first to flesh out information on George senior, but I'm tripping up on the double marriage. My father has confirmed that George worked for Cunard and that he was married twice. The first marriage produced his children.

Thanks for the information you added! I'll try to add and tidy up mine as I go.

Source: Catherine Parkes (March 4, 2017)
